gt 0.1.0

  • Changelog

Arrange a boxhead into panels

Source: R/table_parts.R
tab_boxhead_panel.Rd

Set a spanner with a name and mappings to columns extant in the table. This creates a boxhead panel with spanner headings and column headings.

tab_boxhead_panel(data, group, columns)

Arguments

data

a table object that is created using the gt() function.
group

the name to assign to the spanner heading.
columns

the columns to be components of the spanner heading.

Value

an object of class gt_tbl.

See also

Other table-part creation/modification functions: gt_preview, gt, tab_footnote, tab_heading, tab_options, tab_source_note, tab_stub_block, tab_stubhead_caption, tab_style

Examples

# Create a table based on `rock` where
# there are column headings grouped
# under spanner headings
gt(data = rock) %>%
  tab_boxhead_panel(
    group = "perimeter",
    columns = c("peri", "shape"))
